com.incoming.pvnsdk

Interface DataAccessService


  • public interface DataAccessService
    Placeholder for data access API.

    • Method Detail

      • setNotificationInterval

        void setNotificationInterval(android.util.Pair<Integer,Integer> notificationInterval)
        Change the minimum notification interval.
        Parameters:
        notificationInterval - When user changes notification interval ([min, max]in seconds). Min value 0 = never.

      • setContentTargets

        void setContentTargets(Map<String,Set<String>> targetAttributes)
        Provide custom targeting attributes, for example ‘team’ for a sports app, or ‘topic’ for a news app.
        Parameters:
        targetAttributes - Map of content targeting attributes that can be used for targeting of push videos. e.g. { ‘teams’ : ["Liverpool", "Everton"] }. Each key of the Map refers to a particular segmentation target attribute. Zero, or more, values may be specified for each attribute.
        See Also:
        Audience Segmentation

      • setNotificationDisplayActive

        void setNotificationDisplayActive(boolean displayNotifications)
        Activate or de-activiate notification display. Pre-fetching is also paused while notification display is disabled.
        Parameters:
        displayNotifications - Notifications will be displayed if true, or not displayed if false.

      • isNotificationDisplayActive

        boolean isNotificationDisplayActive()
        Query if notifications are being displayed to the user. Notification display may be activated or de-activated by calling setNotificationDisplayActive(boolean).
        Returns:
        true if notifications are being displayed to the user.

      • getNotificationCandidates

        List<? extends VideoDescriptor> getNotificationCandidates()
        Retrieve a list of videos that can be added to a notification. The list is filtered according to audience segmentation rules. Expired videos, and videos that are still under embargo are exluded from this list.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable list of videos that have been fetched. The list is sorted in the order the videos would be posted in notifications at the time the method was called.

      • getPrefetchQueue

        List<? extends VideoDescriptor> getPrefetchQueue()
        Videos that are available for download. The list is filtered according to audience segmentation rules.
        Returns:
        videos that are available for download

      • getWatchedVideos

        List<? extends VideoDescriptor> getWatchedVideos()
        Videos that have been watched.
        Returns:
        videos that have been watched.

      • getAllAvailableVideos

        List<? extends VideoDescriptor> getAllAvailableVideos()
        This method concatenates the results of getWatchedVideos() and getNotificationCandidates(). The videos are sorted in the order that would be presented in notifications. The time the video was added according to VideoDescriptor.getCreatedEpoch() is the primary factor in determining the order, but videos that have been from embargo recently are promoted, while expired videos are demoted.
        Returns:
        all available videos.

      • enablePrefetch

        void enablePrefetch(boolean enabled)
        Disable or enable pre-fetching. This can be used to provide a user control to turn download on and off.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if videos should be fetched.

      • isPrefetchEnabled

        boolean isPrefetchEnabled()
